response.job_title: New Product Development Specialist - Middle Americas Zone en Anheuser-Busch InBev
response.summary: Chemical engineer with experience in the Brewing industry with special emphasis in R&D of new alcoholic beverages.
response.skills: Chemical Engineering, Microsoft Office, Transport Phenomena, Alcoholic Beverages, Process Engineering, Food Processing, Product Innovation, Brewing

profile_positions.title: New Product Development Specialist - Middle Americas Zone

profile_positions.description:
The brewing specialist is responsible for leading the development of different research and innovations projects focused on beers and alcoholic beverages.
Plan and manage resources to scale up new products from a pilot scale to an industrial scale. 
Brewing specialist has a wide look of brew technologies and a wide knowledge of the brewing process.
As personal achievements, I have been part of the teams that made possible the industrial production of new drinks as:
Colombia: Club Colombia Siembra, BBC: La Cotidiana, Pony Vital, Póker Roja 1929, Costeña Bacana, Póker pura malta, Club Colombia Doble Malta, Nativa, Malta Leona Café.
Ecuador: Club Premium Roja, Club Premium Platino, Pony Fruty Fresh, Nuestra Siembra.
Dominican Republic: Presidente Golden Light.
Perú: Cusqueña Doble Malta, Golden, Cusqueña Doble Malta, Cristal Bicolor.
profile_positions.title: Brewing Innovation Product Specialist - Middle Americas Zone

profile_positions.description: Perform basic physicochemical analysis of beers and sodas. Control and supervise the production schedules of research plant brewery. Lead the implementation of quality pillar of Voyager Plant Optimization (VPO). Training in brewing and management of plant.
profile_positions.title: Chemical Analyst - Experimental Plant

profile_positions.description: Experience in development and research of new products, physical-chemical analysis of beer and sodas and applications of new supplies. Knowledge of brewing operations such as production of wort, fermentation, filtration and manufacturing of final product. Basic ideas on HCM and 5S methodologies. My final project in the internship was the adaptation of one BBT as carbonator and mixer for manufacturing the final product.
profile_positions.title: Research and Development Intern - Pilot Plant

company.name: AB InBev
company.description:
As a company, we dream big to create a future with more cheers. We are always looking to serve up new ways to meet life’s moments, move our industry forward and make a meaningful impact in the world. We are committed to building great brands that stand the test of time and to brewing the best beers using the finest ingredients.

Our diverse portfolio of well over 500 beer brands includes global brands Budweiser®, Corona® and Stella Artois®; multi-country brands Beck’s®, Hoegaarden®, Leffe® and Michelob ULTRA®; and local champions such as Aguila®, Antarctica®, Bud Light®, Brahma®, Cass®, Castle®, Castle Lite®, Cristal®, Harbin®, Jupiler®, Modelo Especial®, Quilmes®, Victoria®, Sedrin®, and Skol®.

Our brewing heritage dates back more than 600 years, spanning continents and generations. From our European roots at the Den Hoorn brewery in Leuven, Belgium. To the pioneering spirit of the Anheuser & Co brewery in St. Louis, US. To the creation of the Castle Brewery in South Africa during the Johannesburg gold rush. To Bohemia, the first brewery in Brazil.

Geographically diversified with a balanced exposure to developed and developing markets, we leverage the collective strengths of approximately 167,000 colleagues based in nearly 50 countries worldwide.
